title: 18F-AV-1451 PET Imaging in the Preclinical, Prodromal and Dementia Phases of Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: A Phase 1 study designed to evaluate imaging characteristics of flortaucipir in the preclinical, prodromal and dementia phases of Alzheimer's disease.
description_detailed: The Australian Imaging Biomarkers and Lifestyle Study (AIBL) is a multicenter multidisciplinary study of Alzheimer's disease and aging funded by the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) Flagship Initiative, involving research centers in both Victoria and Western Australia. The goal of the A08 protocol was to further investigate the positron emission tomography (PET) imaging results with flortaucipir in patients across the AD spectrum from individuals with subjective memory complaints (SMC) to those with dementia, based on recruitment into the parent AIBL study.

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Enrollment occurred between Oct 2014 and Feb 2018 from the Australian Imaging, Biomarker \& Lifestyle Flagship Study of Ageing (AIBL)

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Mini Mental Status Exam (MMSE)
measures.description: Mini-mental status exam (MMSE) is a 30-point questionnaire that is used to measure cognitive impairment. Scores range from 0 to 30 with lower scores representing greater levels of cognitive impairment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir PET Imaging (Quantitative)
outcomeMeasures.description: Flortaucipir PET cortical weighted average standardized uptake value ratio (SUVr). For SUVr, a value of 1 signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Inclusion in this analysis required that the subject's flortaucipir scan was analyzable for SUVr (1 AD, 1 MCI, 5 SMC, and 3 CN were not analyzable)

analyses.statisticalComment: The two-way ANOVA included cognitive and amyloid status, and their interaction as fixed effects.
The two-way ANOVA included cognitive and amyloid status, and their interaction as fixed effects.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Advanced AD Pattern Flortaucipir PET Scan and Relationship to Cognitive Status
outcomeMeasures.description: Scans were visually read independently by two expert readers at the sponsor, blinded to any clinical information. Subject scans were categorized as follows: Advanced AD Scan Pattern (τAD++), Moderate AD Scan Pattern (τAD+), Not AD Scan Pattern (τAD-). For this analysis, subjects with Advanced (τAD++) scans were analyzed vs. the combined Moderate and Not AD pattern groups (τAD+/τAD-). Amyloid status was obtained by florbetapir or carbon-11-labeled Pittsburgh compound B (\[C-11\] PiB) PET results available from the parent AIBL study.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Rows display flortaucipir scan results by subjects who were amyloid positive and amyloid negative at baseline

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With AD Pattern Flortaucipir PET Scan and Relationship to Cognitive Status
outcomeMeasures.description: Scans were visually read independently by two expert readers at the sponsor, blinded to any clinical information. Subject scans were categorized as follows: Advanced AD Scan Pattern (τAD++), Moderate AD Scan Pattern (τAD+), Not AD Scan Pattern (τAD-). For this analysis, subjects with AD Pattern scans (Advanced \[τAD++\] and Moderate \[τAD+\] Scan Pattern) were combined vs. the Not AD pattern group (τAD-). Amyloid status was obtained by florbetapir or carbon-11-labeled Pittsburgh compound B (\[C-11\] PiB) PET results available from the parent AIBL study.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: End of study for AE reporting was 48 hours after flortaucipir administration at each imaging visit.
adverseEventsModule.description: Adverse Events were defined as occurring or worsening after injection of dose, within 48 hours post injection, at an imaging visit. AEs occurring after study drug administration, but outside that window were not recorded, unless considered attributable to flortaucipir.

explanation_target: Reason: The study describes PET imaging with flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451) across preclinical, prodromal and dementia phases of Alzheimer’s disease. Flortaucipir is a radiolabeled PET tracer that binds tau neurofibrillary tangles and is used as an in vivo tau imaging biomarker, i.e., a diagnostic/imaging agent rather than a therapeutic drug; therefore the trial is non‑therapeutic and does not fit the four therapeutic categories. citeturn0search5turn0search1

Act (extracted details): Intervention = flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451 / 18F‑T807), modality = PET imaging of tau pathology in AD (preclinical → dementia). This is an imaging/biomarker Phase 1 study to evaluate imaging characteristics, not a treatment intended to modify disease, improve cognition, or treat neuropsychiatric symptoms. Classification chosen: N/A. citeturn0search5turn0search6

Reflect: The available literature confirms flortaucipir is a tau PET ligand used for in vivo detection and quantification of tau aggregates in AD and related disorders; several studies discuss its retention patterns and limitations (e.g., off‑target binding and variable affinity across non‑AD tauopathies), reinforcing that its role is diagnostic/biomarker rather than therapeutic. Thus 'N/A' (diagnostic imaging study) is the appropriate category. citeturn0search0turn0search3turn0search7

Web search results (sources used): (1) Brain / multicentre longitudinal evaluation describing flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451, 18F‑T807) as a tau PET tracer used in normal ageing, MCI and AD dementia. citeturn0search5 (2) PubMed articles and reviews showing 18F‑flortaucipir binds paired helical filament (PHF)‑tau in AD and noting utility/limitations across other tauopathies. citeturn0search1turn0search0 (3) Studies/postmortem series discussing off‑target binding and limited affinity in some non‑AD tauopathies (CTE, FTD), relevant to imaging interpretation. citeturn0search3turn0search7
